item.title: Pico De-Gallo
item.description:
A simple, fresh, delicious appetizer or side for any Mexican dish or party.

  • 1 tomato
  • 1⁄2 jalapeño
  • 1 clove garlic
  • a little red onion
  • a bit of cilantro
  • some lime juice
  • salt and pepper

Dice tomato and red onion. Mince jalapeño, garlic, and chop cilantro. Combine in a bowl. Add lime juice, salt, and pepper to taste.

item.title: Panko Cod
item.description:
Cod covered in panko and pan fried.

  • 1 lbs Cod
  • 2 cups Panko Bread Crumbs
  • 1 cup flour
  • 2 large eggs
  • salt and pepper OR old bay
  • peanut oil

Heat peanut oil in large skillet.

Season cod. Coat in flour, egg, and then panko. Fry in pan until golden and cooked through, about 1 minute per side.

item.title: Sauteed Shrimp
item.description:
Shrimp with red-pepper flakes and fresh herbs.

  • 1.5 lbs large shrimp
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 2 tbsp chopped fresh parsley
  • 2 tbsp chopped fresh oregano
  • pinch crushed red-pepper flakes
  • 1⁄2 cup dry white wine
  • salt and pepper

Heat oil in large skillet. Add garlic and cook until soft, 1 to 2 minutes. Add shrimp, parsley, oregano, and red-pepper flakes. Cook until shrimp are pink and opaque, about 2 minutes.

Raise heat to medium-high and add wine. Cook until most of the liquid has evaporated.

item.title: Snappy Salmon Filets
item.description:
Simple salmon filets with a hint of sweetness.

  • 1⁄4 cup Soy Sauce
  • 1 tbsp brown sugar
  • 2 tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 salmon filets

Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice. Marinate salmon in mixture for 30 to 40 minutes turning over once. Broil salmon 4 minutes on each side.
